bin/cbtsp.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Constrained Bottleneck TSP heuristic.
00003  *
00004  * Runs the Constrained Bottleneck TSP heuristic on the given input file.  
00005  *
00006  * @author  John LaRusic
00007  * @ingroup bin
00008  ****************************************************************************/
00009 #include "arrow.h"
00010 
00011 /* Global variables */
00012 char *input_file = NULL;
00013 char *xml_file = NULL;
00014 char *tour_file = NULL;
00015 double length = DBL_MAX;
00016 int random_restarts = 5;
00017 int stall_count = -1;
00018 int kicks = -1;
00019 int confirm_sol = ARROW_FALSE;
00020 int supress_ebst = ARROW_FALSE;
00021 int find_short_tour = ARROW_FALSE;
00022 int lower_bound = -1;
00023 int upper_bound = INT_MAX;
00024 int basic_attempts = 3;
00025 int shake_attempts = 2;
00026 int shake_rand_min = 0;
00027 int shake_rand_max = -1;
00028 int random_seed = 0;
00029 
00030 
00031 /* Program options */
00032 #define NUM_OPTS 17
00033 arrow_option options[NUM_OPTS] = 
00034 {
00035     {'i', "input", "TSPLIB input file", 
00036         ARROW_OPTION_STRING, &input_file, ARROW_TRUE, ARROW_TRUE},
00037     {'x', "xml", "file to write XML output to",
00038         ARROW_OPTION_STRING, &xml_file, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00039     {'T', "tour", "file to write tour to",
00040         ARROW_OPTION_STRING, &tour_file, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00041         
00042     {'L', "length", "maximum tour length",
00043         ARROW_OPTION_DOUBLE, &length, ARROW_TRUE, ARROW_TRUE},
00044     
00045     {'r', "restarts", "number of random restarts",
00046         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &random_restarts, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00047     {'s', "stall-count", "max number of 4-swaps w/o progress",
00048         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &stall_count, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00049     {'k', "kicks", "number of 4-swap kicks",
00050         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &kicks, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00051     {'c', "confirm-solution", "confirm solution with exact solver",
00052         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &confirm_sol, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_FALSE},
00053     {'e', "supress-ebst", "supress binary search",
00054         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &supress_ebst, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_FALSE},
00055     {'S', "find-short-tour", "finds a (relatively) short BTSP tour",
00056         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &find_short_tour, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_FALSE},
00057         
00058     {'l', "lower-bound", "initial lower bound",
00059         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &lower_bound, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00060     {'u', "upper-bound", "initial upper bound",
00061         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &upper_bound, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00062         
00063     {'a', "basic-attempts", "number of basic attempts",
00064         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &basic_attempts, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00065         
00066     {'b', "shake-attempts", "number of shake attempts",
00067         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &shake_attempts, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00068     {'1', "shake-rand-min", "min value for shake random numbers",
00069         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &shake_rand_min, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00070     {'2', "shake-rand-max", "max value for shake random numbers",
00071         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &shake_rand_max, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00072         
00073     {'g', "random-seed", "random number generator seed",
00074         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &random_seed, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE}
00075 };
00076 char *desc = "Bottleneck traveling salesman problem (BTSP) solver";
00077 char *usage = "-i tsplib.tsp -L max_length [options]";
00078 
00079 /* Main method */
00080 int 
00081 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00082 {   
00083     int ret = EXIT_SUCCESS;
00084 
00085     arrow_problem problem;
00086     arrow_problem_info info;
00087     arrow_tsp_lk_params lk_params;
00088     arrow_btsp_fun fun_con;
00089     arrow_btsp_fun fun_con_shake;
00090     arrow_btsp_result result;
00091     
00092     double start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00093     double end_time;
00094     double bbssp_time = -1.0;
00095     
00096     /* Read program arguments */
00097     if(!arrow_options_parse(NUM_OPTS, options, desc, usage, argc, argv, NULL))
00098         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00099         
00100     /* Try and read the problem file and its info */
00101     if(!arrow_problem_read(input_file, &problem))
00102         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00103     if(!arrow_problem_info_get(&problem, &info))
00104         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00105         
00106     /* Extra processing for arguments */
00107     if(shake_rand_max < 0) shake_rand_max = 
00108         (problem.size * problem.size) + shake_rand_min;
00109     if(shake_rand_max - shake_rand_min < info.cost_list_length)
00110     {
00111         arrow_print_error("shake random interval not large enough");
00112         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00113     }
00114     
00115     /* Initialize random number generator */
00116     arrow_util_random_seed(random_seed);
00117     
00118     /* Determine if we need to call the BBSSP to find a lower bound */
00119     if(lower_bound < 0)
00120     {
00121         printf("Solving BBSSP to find a lower bound... ");
00122         arrow_bound_result bbssp_result;
00123         if(!arrow_bbssp_solve(&problem, &info, &bbssp_result))
00124         {
00125             arrow_print_error("Could not solve BBSSP on file.\n");
00126             return EXIT_FAILURE;
00127         }
00128         lower_bound = bbssp_result.obj_value;
00129         bbssp_time = bbssp_result.total_time;
00130         printf("done!  BBSSP lower bound is %d.\n", lower_bound);
00131     }
00132     
00133     /* Setup LK parameters structure */
00134     arrow_tsp_lk_params_init(&problem, &lk_params);
00135     if(random_restarts >= 0)    lk_params.random_restarts  = random_restarts;
00136     if(stall_count >= 0)        lk_params.stall_count      = stall_count;
00137     if(kicks >= 0)              lk_params.kicks            = kicks;
00138     lk_params.length_bound = length;
00139     
00140     /* Setup necessary function structures */
00141     if(!arrow_btsp_fun_constrained(ARROW_FALSE, length, length + 1, &fun_con))
00142         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00143         
00144     if(!arrow_btsp_fun_constrained_shake(ARROW_FALSE, length, length + 1, 
00145                                          shake_rand_min, shake_rand_max, 
00146                                          &problem, &info, &fun_con_shake))
00147         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00148     
00149     #define SOLVE_STEPS 2
00150     arrow_btsp_solve_plan steps[SOLVE_STEPS] = 
00151     {
00152        {
00153            ARROW_BTSP_SOLVE_PLAN_CONSTRAINED, /* plan_type */
00154            ARROW_FALSE,                       /* use_exact_solver? */
00155            fun_con,                           /* fun (cost matrix function) */
00156            lk_params,                         /* LK parameters */
00157            ARROW_FALSE,                       /* upper_bound_update? */
00158            basic_attempts                     /* attempts */
00159        },
00160        {
00161            ARROW_BTSP_SOLVE_PLAN_CONSTRAINED_SHAKE,
00162            ARROW_FALSE,
00163            fun_con_shake,
00164            lk_params,
00165            ARROW_FALSE,
00166            shake_attempts
00167        }
00168     };
00169     
00170     /* Setup BTSP parameters structure */
00171     arrow_btsp_params btsp_params;
00172     arrow_btsp_params_init(&btsp_params);
00173     btsp_params.confirm_sol         = confirm_sol;
00174     btsp_params.supress_ebst        = supress_ebst;
00175     btsp_params.find_short_tour     = find_short_tour;
00176     btsp_params.lower_bound         = lower_bound;
00177     btsp_params.upper_bound         = upper_bound;
00178     btsp_params.num_steps           = SOLVE_STEPS;
00179     btsp_params.steps               = steps;
00180     
00181     /* Setup BTSP results structure */
00182     arrow_btsp_result_init(&problem, &result);
00183     if(!arrow_btsp_solve(&problem, &info, &btsp_params, &result))
00184     {
00185         ret = EXIT_FAILURE;
00186         goto CLEANUP;
00187     }
00188     end_time = arrow_util_zeit() - start_time;
00189     
00190     /* Check */
00191     int k, u, v;
00192     int cost, max_cost = INT_MIN;
00193     double len = 0.0;
00194     if(result.found_tour)
00195     {
00196         for(k = 0; k < problem.size; k++)
00197         {
00198             u = result.tour[k];
00199             v = result.tour[(k + 1) % problem.size];
00200             cost = problem.get_cost(&problem, u, v);
00201             len += cost;
00202             if(cost > max_cost) max_cost = cost;
00203             if(cost > result.obj_value)
00204             {
00205                 fprintf(stderr, "FUCK. %s\n", input_file);
00206                 return EXIT_FAILURE;
00207             }
00208         }
00209         printf("CHECK Tour Length: %.0f\n", len);
00210         printf("CHECK Max Cost: %d\n", max_cost);
00211     }
00212 
00213     /* Output result */
00214     printf("\nFound Tour: %s\n", (result.found_tour ? "Yes" : "No"));
00215     if(result.found_tour)
00216     {
00217         printf("Max. Cost: %d\n", result.obj_value);
00218         printf("Tour Length: %.0f\n", result.tour_length);
00219     }
00220     printf("Initial Lower Bound: %d\n", lower_bound);
00221     if(bbssp_time >= 0.0)
00222         printf("BBSSP Time: %.2f\n", bbssp_time);        
00223     printf("Optimal?: %s\n", 
00224         (result.optimal == ARROW_TRUE ? "Yes" : "???"));
00225     printf("Binary Search Steps: %d\n", result.bin_search_steps);
00226     printf("Lin-Kernighan Calls: %d\n", result.linkern_attempts);
00227     if(result.linkern_attempts > 0)
00228         printf("Avg. Lin-Kernighan Time: %.2f\n", 
00229             result.linkern_time / (result.linkern_attempts * 1.0));
00230     printf("Exact TSP Calls: %d\n", result.exact_attempts);
00231     if(result.exact_attempts > 0)
00232         printf("Avg. Exact TSP Time: %.2f\n", 
00233             result.exact_time / (result.exact_attempts * 1.0));
00234     printf("Total BTSP Time: %.2f\n", result.total_time);
00235     printf("Total Time: %.2f\n", end_time);
00236     
00237     /* Tour output */
00238     if((result.found_tour) && (tour_file != NULL))
00239     {
00240         FILE *tour;
00241         char comment[256];
00242         
00243         if(!(tour = fopen(tour_file, "w")))
00244         {
00245             arrow_print_error("Could not open tour file for writing");
00246             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00247             goto CLEANUP;
00248         }
00249         
00250         sprintf(comment, "CBTSP Tour (k= %.0f); Length %.0f, Max Cost %d.",
00251             length, result.tour_length, result.obj_value);
00252         
00253         arrow_util_write_tour(&problem, comment, result.tour, tour);
00254         
00255         fclose(tour);
00256     }
00257     
00258     /* Xml output */
00259     if(xml_file != NULL)
00260     {
00261         FILE *xml;
00262         if(!(xml = fopen(xml_file, "w")))
00263         {
00264             arrow_print_error("Could not open xml file for writing");
00265             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00266             goto CLEANUP;
00267         }
00268         
00269         fprintf(xml, "<arrow_cbtsp problem_file=\"%s\"", input_file);
00270         fprintf(xml, " command_args=\"");
00271         arrow_util_print_program_args(argc, argv, xml);
00272         fprintf(xml, "\">\n");
00273         
00274         fprintf(xml, "    <max_length>%.0f</max_length>\n", length);
00275         fprintf(xml, "    <found_tour>%s</found_tour>\n", 
00276                 (result.found_tour ? "true" : "false"));
00277         fprintf(xml, "    <objective_value>%d</objective_value>\n", 
00278                 (result.found_tour ? result.obj_value : -1));
00279         fprintf(xml, "    <tour_length>%.0f</tour_length>\n", 
00280                 (result.found_tour ? result.tour_length : -1.0));
00281         fprintf(xml, "    <optimal>%s</optimal>\n", 
00282                 (result.optimal ? "true" : "false"));
00283         fprintf(xml, "    <lower_bound>%d</lower_bound>\n", lower_bound);
00284         fprintf(xml, "    <lower_bound_time>%.2f</lower_bound_time>\n",
00285                 bbssp_time);
00286         fprintf(xml, "    <binary_search_steps>%d</binary_search_steps>\n",
00287                 result.bin_search_steps);
00288         fprintf(xml, "    <linkern_attempts>%d</linkern_attempts>\n",
00289                 result.linkern_attempts);
00290         fprintf(xml, "    <linkern_avg_time>%.2f</linkern_avg_time>\n", 
00291                 (result.linkern_attempts > 0 
00292                  ? result.linkern_time / (result.linkern_attempts * 1.0) 
00293                  : 0.0));
00294         fprintf(xml, "    <exact_tsp_attempts>%d</exact_tsp_attempts>\n",
00295                 result.exact_attempts);
00296         fprintf(xml, "    <exact_tsp_avg_time>%.2f</exact_tsp_avg_time>\n", 
00297                 (result.exact_attempts > 0 
00298                  ? result.exact_time / (result.exact_attempts * 1.0) 
00299                  : 0.0));
00300         fprintf(xml, "    <btsp_total_time>%.2f</btsp_total_time>\n",
00301                 result.total_time);
00302         fprintf(xml, "    <total_time>%.2f</total_time>\n", end_time);
00303         fprintf(xml, "</arrow_cbtsp>\n");
00304         
00305         fclose(xml);
00306     }
00307     
00308 CLEANUP:
00309     arrow_btsp_result_destruct(&result);
00310     /*arrow_btsp_fun_destruct(&fun_constrained);*/
00311     arrow_btsp_params_destruct(&btsp_params);
00312     arrow_tsp_lk_params_destruct(&lk_params);
00313     arrow_problem_destruct(&problem);
00314     return ret;
00315 }
